intro: Pavetta batanensis, commonly known as Batan pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
